resources.string: Are you sure you want to leave?
These are the instructions for using RCJeff. Make sure you read them thoroughly!\nBelow are the navigation buttons marked with > and <.
Plug the Raspberry Pi into the battery pack included at the back of the car by using the attatched cable.

Go into your Wi-Fi settings and wait for the network "raspinet" to appear. Connect to that network using the password "fireitup".\nThere isn\'t supposed to be an online connection, but just a connection to the network. Once you are connected to the network, move on to the next instruction.
Flip the car over and make sure that the power switch is switched on.
Click start in the main activity and wait for your device to connect to the car.
This is the control panel. Click the arrows to control the car\'s movement, or click "AUTO" to make it follow the orange rectangle.

The car has two engines- one for back-forward, one for left-right. Note that the car is based off a cheap toy and since the motors are fragile and tend to heat and expand, you shouldn\'t fire each engine for more than a few seconds.
You are ready to go! The next page includes troubleshooting options.

1. My car moves but won't turn!
You may have destroyed the engines.

2. I can't connect to the car!
Make sure that you are connected to "raspinet".

3. My car won't move at all!
Did you flip the switch at the bottom of the car?

4. It says that I'm connected but the picture is frozen!
Kill the connection and restart it. This can happen rarely.
